column4: Weasel[DK], not really.  You don't get whatever gain you would from the 64bit OS, but 32bit OS wont run slower on it
i had the same thought as your...but when i intalled a winxp-64BE on a athlon 64 x2, some apps really run faster than on a 32BE
for example games
so why on ubuntu it would be different?
i mean if there was no difference between 32 and 63 bit editions, so why does the 64BE exist?
The 64bit OS is faster in some areas, but most general application use there is little, if any, difference.
the benefit of larger registers and more of them is offset by the overhead of larger pointers and such
/home is where everything *you* personally own is in (well, users as a whole), and / is where everything else is (everything that doesnt have its own partition)
I don't get it. They are the same or they represent different partitions?
/ contains /home and everything else (/var, /usr, /etc, etc) however, you *can* make dedicated partitions for any arbitrary folder and use it as that folder
so you mean that "/" is the father of any other partition created...is it?
no, / is a "label" you give to a partition.  Partitions are physical things (theyre sections of the disk), the folder things are sematics more or less.  Just how linux uses those partitions
wav files are about 85KB per second
Indeed.
gloobus is in Karmic, its brand new, etc.
what do u mean?
i saw guides for ubuntu 8.10 also
Hmmm, no, nevermind.  It's not in karmic.  https://launchpad.net/gloobus  They've apparently released a deb, but I can't find it on that page.
You'll want to follow the guides then.  It's not in the repos

mmm..the only downloadable package is for karmic..
is it possible to install?
I have no idea.  I'm not familiar with that package/program at all, you might ask whatever support/forums/whatever they have
